author: kirsty822
title: I felt cared for and that I was not alone
body:
After finding out at my 12-week scan that my pregnancy was a miscarriage, I was contacted by the team straight away.  
From the first phone contact, I felt cared for and that I was not alone.  
I went in to see the midwife, Sarah, initially to discuss options for managing the miscarriage and was so grateful for how kind and supportive she was. I felt very vulnerable and did not know what the right decision was. I felt like she gave me the time to talk about my feelings, really listened to me, and gave me all the right information to make a decision on the best way to manage the miscarriage. I changed my mind and was made to feel like it was no trouble.  
Everything was organised with no stress for me and I was told about information online from miscarriage association, which helped me to figure things out after I’d had the physical procedure and was still recovering emotionally.  
I cannot thank Sarah and the team enough for their compassionate care and help at a very sad time.

author: Jaycee Gee
title: Their kindness & experience shone through
body:
Today I accompanied my friend to an appointment she had with the Rushcliffe Community Respiratory Team. She has had COPD for many years & I have just been diagnosed with it. In fact it was her that first spotted the signs & told me that’s how she started.  
So after the coughing fits, chest infections, bronchitis, breathing difficulties & all the other things that were going on with me I had blood, breathing & various other tests. She was right, unfortunately I also have COPD. This diagnosis has devastated & to some extent, traumatised me. I know that might sound dramatic, but having little knowledge on the subject except for the awful experiences of my friend, it frightened & panicked me beyond words & left me full of dread & feeling very morbid.  
Getting back to today, this was her second appointment with them & I was there just to support her really.  
I was apprehensive about what I was going into, but tried not to show it because I knew this appointment would be upsetting for my friend & I wanted to be there for her.  
The two nurses we saw, Elizabeth & Claire, were two of the nicest & understanding nurses I have ever met. They were very knowledgeable & informative, clear, calm, caring & encouraging. They listened without prejudice or judgement & really gave my friend the human touch she so deserves. We both felt that she finally had someone who she could rely on for help & support & who had her best overall interests at heart.  
They covered a lot of things to help her, & inadvertently me, to manage & live with this awful deliberating disease. They pointed her in the right direction to get further, much needed help & guidance on a variety of subjects that she is trying to deal with. They really know their onions & gave us both a reassurance & hopefulness we didn’t have before the appointment, they understood, acknowledged & advised on every aspect & the affects of learning to adapt to living with COPD. We were both educated & had lots of concerns answered.  
To anyone who is nervous & anxious, they were a godsend, their kindness & experience shone through.  
If any of you are ever privileged enough to get an appointment with Elizabeth & Claire, you will be in safe hands, they were wonderful & are a credit to Rushcliffe Community Respiratory Team.

author: Ratboy's mum
title: This service saved my son's life
body:
Following numerous appointments to see the GP regarding my concern about my son's lack of food intake, weight loss and suicidal thoughts, he was eventually referred to the CAMHS service.  
This service saved his life, he would not be alive today had it not been for the prompt assessment and intervention of each health professional we seen during the first appointment in Coathill.  
The decision was made to admit him to Skye House for assessment and the care from there was amazing. Following discharge he had input from the CITT team, who came to my house every day, offering support to everyone in the house.  
I think we met most staff in the team and my son built up good relationships , especially with James, Evan, Lauren, Sandra and Tricia. As a parent, I naturally blamed myself for his anorexia, but the staff were all very supportive and never judgmental when they visited.  
We were supplied with lots of resources with insightful information on eating disorders. They also made clear safety plans for my son whenever dark thoughts entered his head. He was discharged from the service yesterday following a year of intensive input from CITT and FBT and I'm delighted to say he is a different boy.  
It has been the toughest year of his life and the impact it had on our household, work and school was hard at times, but I will be eternally grateful to this service for everything you have all done, we really couldn't have came through this alone. I also want to give special thanks to Alistair for his patience in FBT, and to Marianna who has been with my son since day one. You are all fabulous!!

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Reanne
title: My recovery from addiction
body:
Over a thirty-year period, my addiction took me to some terrifying places. Addiction gave me injuries, illnesses, humiliation and a constant feeling of uneasiness. By the end, I was trapped in a never-ending Groundhog Day, isolated and in fear of everything and everyone. I was so ill that I became petrified that I would die, but at the same time, I didn’t want to live anymore.  
I have completed several detoxes over the years, many that I have had to beg for, but have always ended up relapsing again and again. I couldn’t break the cycle. My situation was hopeless.  
After my last relapse, I went into a private rehab for a month. While in there, I communicated with CGL workers. I now understood that a detox and a few weeks away was not going to be sufficient if I was to hold on to my sobriety. Something needed to change. CGL assured me that they were setting me up on their Day Programme, which I could access as soon as I left the rehab. They also told me about their Anxiety group, which I started remotely while in the treatment centre, and about their Creative group.  
When I entered the rehab, I had been too afraid to speak to anyone. The Day Programme would involve daily groups where I would be expected to engage. Although I was fearful, I knew that the uncomfortable feelings I had around this had to be put aside if I was to have any kind of sober future.  
On leaving the rehab, I started the daily groups. I had already begun to build a trusting relationship with the staff and this helped me with my confidence. I went from having a chaotic lifestyle to have a daily routine where I would be expected to show up and be accountable. As well as developing my own skills to avoid relapse, I also learnt about the value of helping other addicts with their recovery.  
Finally, I started to believe that sobriety did not need to be a temporary thing and that it was something that could be a possibility for me long-term. I began attending 12 step meetings and found a sponsor to support me. I would look forward to and contribute to the groups. My self-esteem started to grow. I enjoyed the trips out we had at Cannon Hill Park and to the city centre during the Commonwealth Games. I got to meet people in person and learnt to have a good time without mind-altering substances. I felt closer to the staff and the group members as a result. I realised that other people could like me for who I am and I made friends.  
The Anxiety group equipped me with techniques, which I still use in situations today when things become stressful. The Creative writing group showed me that I could actually be good at something.  
Since leaving the Day Programme, I have a much more positive outlook on life. I have been invited to CGL South hub to share my experiences about the 12 steps and recovery, to the women’s group to talk to clients and to the 168 groups. Talking to groups of strangers would not have been possible a year ago. Now, at almost a year free of all mind-altering substances, I am eternally grateful to the staff who believed in me and who continue to believe in me.

author: indiahw66
title: Fantastic staff at 111
body:
I had a cough and cold for 1 month,then Sunday I became very wheezy and slightly short of breath so I rang 111 after speaking to 3 lovely people. I was diagnosed with asthma. I was given steroids, ventolin, and antibiotics.  
Today I feel much better thanks to all the fantastic staff at 111.

author: Hope101
title: Good Work Ethic
body:
I was diagnosed with psychosis in 2021 - I was admitted to the Priory. The staff were absolutely amazing could not thank them enough. They catered for my needs and even had halal food on the menu. Thank You :-) Priory Arnold Calverton.  
Mary Potters - Thank you to Dr Chamberline and Dr Kagzi for the tremendous work they do on a day to day basis.

author: Scott 62
title: Excellent service
body: Excellent service from the practice. Receptionist was very pleasant and helpful. Needed an appointment for my daughter who has just registered with the practice. I called at 14.30 and got an appointment for 16.30. Excellent service.

author: ClaireBear
title: Local Health Centre
body:
I find my local health centre is appalling. Once you get to a GP they are reasonably decent, but first you need to navigate the reception admin staff. Regardless of medical experience they decide whether you get to see a medical professional. In the past I’ve presented with sepsis and been turned away.  
Today I have been trying to get a sickline, which I requested 5 days ago. I’ve had major surgery and am recovering, driving is a problem right now, and you’d think being able to have the sickline emailed would be a boon. No, this surgery has been experiencing IT difficulties for over a month and still haven’t contacted NHS IT support. That’s how this practice rolls.  
I’m now getting a lift to collect my sickline, then being driven a 60 mile round trip to deliver it in time for payroll.  
Be very aware if you join this practice you cannot expect efficiency, empathy or even correct medical assessment.  
Once it was a good practice, no longer sadly.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: qhcresident
title: Hospital treatment after a stroke
body:
After a 111 call resulting from my wife's concerns over slight facial droop and slightly slurred speech, an ambulance arrived within 10 minutes and I was very quickly transferred to Wycombe hospital where the MRI team were actually waiting for me! I was quickly assessed and then hurried into the scan area. All done within 15 minutes then back to the bay for blood tests and ECG.  
Visit by consultant neurologist within the hour and then check-ups with doctor/nurses until the result of the scan and bloods were known. Prescription issued, letter to my surgery prepared and I was home within 4 hrs or so. Could not have had more urgent attention or more care shown. Friendly, reassuring, caring - top service. Admittedly the hospital was relatively quiet that day and perhaps I was fortunate but even allowing for that, I was the lucky recipient of excellent care and service. Thanks to all in that unit.

author: statusxd58
title: Pleasant staff
body: Very efficient staff & pleasant. Great workforce.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: AD2022
title: Missed Telephone Appointment
body:
After waiting for weeks, I was expecting a telephone appointment at 12.30 pm. When I was in the bathroom at 12.15 pm the consultant had tried to phone me presumably, as there was a missed call from the withheld number.  
After no further calls were received I contacted the appointments office, I was recorded as a DNA/did not attend. And I was told it looked like I’d been discharged. Having waited since last August for a review appointment, finding out my original consultant had left & having to get my GP to do another referral, I feel absolutely devastated. I have a very painful chronic condition. The person I spoke to in appointments was so kind to me when I was upset, they said they were sending an email & gave me the secretary’s number. So at least that was something positive.  
I’d previously spoken to a manager and had emailed the appointments office yesterday inquiring if I could have a face to face meeting. Hopefully perhaps a cancellation had become available etc. On both occasions I was advised that a telephone appointment was the only option.  
Doctors who are marking patients as DNA are bound to be well aware of the struggles for patients to be seen in the NHS & private sector. I think there should be a more professional and certainly more humane way of treating people who are unwell and vulnerable. I hope this leads to a change for other patients.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: magpiezw59
title: A great Service
body: I had a great service.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: aprilxs56
title: Excellent experience
body: My experience has been excellent.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: paprikasw67
title: No long waiting times
body: On time, no long waiting times. Service great. No complaints.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Lauren77
title: Urgent Paediatric Referral
body:
Our almost 11-year-old was referred urgently to paediatrics due to sudden total incontinence, including losing the ability to tell her bladder is full.  
Seen within a week to be sent off with an urgent kidney ultrasound and told it's stress incontinence and we'd maybe have to retrain her pelvis floor. Upon further research and speaking with specialists, I've discovered it's not at all and that this is an urgent matter with potential for brain and spinal causes.  
Upon calling back I was advised they could do a referral for an MRI but not as a matter of urgency. I've now received a follow up appointment for 6 months' times (despite the consultant having said they would call to check in in 2 weeks..they haven't).  
This is a child who was fully continent for 8+ years and has never as much as wet the bed now lives in nappies and this change was overnight. There was no support offered such as how we manage in between times, anything to look out for, details of the incontinence team who could prescribe necessary pads.  
I called recently to check the progress of the ultrasound, to be advised they were waiting on a new rota so only just received that appointment now. Meanwhile I have a terrified and confused pre-teen with rapidly dwindling mental health due to this. I think it's simply unacceptable.  
I want to end by saying we have a really good relationship with many of the staff in ward 19 & 20, and grateful for the work they do for our youngest.

title: Worst experience I've had with a mental health…
body:
I called to ask about my plan and steps I should take moving forward.
They have all my details on record.
1.i was given a service that is not even fo my age group which made me feel worse as I had to call back and tell them, it felt as though they weren't even listening in the first place.
2.i called and spoke to someone who was very rude,  I told this man I feel suicidal and I need someone to talk to now and his response was 'well there's no one to talk to now' in a very blunt tone, this made me feel so more worthless...I asked again with all the little strength left in me, after the third time he finally recommended a line and I asked why he didn't say that before , he ignored me and said here is the number, I paused and asked "do you know your dealing with people's life in your hand" and he said yes I know.
I expressed how little he just made me feel with my voice breaking and he remained silent and said. 
"Here's the number" I was very taken a back and asked if he had anything to say...an apology maybe..
He paused for a few seconds and said "sorry you feel that way here's the number" In a very passive aggressive tone, it felt forced and he did not mean it nor bother to act like he meant it. Remind you I just voiced how suicidal I feel and I'm trying to push. 
I have spoken to a lot of different people in regards to my mental health and no one has made me feel this way until this interaction .
After this phone call I cried for about 3 hours straight contemplating my life and if I should be here. That is now how a crisis line should make you feel. 
My family and friends had to act very fast to protect me from hurting myself, through prayer and love.
I'm lucky I have that...but I wonder if it was someone else who doesn't have the luxury of support outside of the crisis team what would have they done?

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

author: Maisie20
title: Living with the pain of arthritis and how it affects everyday life.
body:
Have struggled with arthritis for years. The pain became so severe that it affected my everyday activities needing help with various things that you take for granted such as : getting in and out of bed , going up stairs , getting up and down on toilet , standing too long when working in the kitchen plus dropping a lot of pots and dishes . Simple things that become frustrating when you have to ask for help. It's losing your independence that can cause you to become depressed with yourself. Going out on my own was a bit frightening as I tend to lose my balance and had a few falls granted they were more embarrassing than painful. Walking too far is a struggle.  
Things have become easier since Conner visit and all the help he advised and the equipment he arranged to make life a lot easier so Thank you so much. It's very much appreciated

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Hector475
title: Prostate cancer and radiotherapy
body:
My father died of prostate cancer, and then I heard that a relative on my father's side was being treated for this, so I asked my GP to have a PSA test. It was raised, so I was then referred to PRI for examination and tests, then to Ninewells for scans, which resulted in a 20-day radiotherapy course.  
I had good, reassuring and full advice all the way through.

author: liontf99
title: Dealing with cancer
body: I have visited Beverly in the macmillan centre at Lincoln several times. She has always made me feel like she totally gets how I'm feeling. She has been supportive and reassuring throughout and I feel I can talk to her about how I exactly feel. She has offered me the guidance and advice about what I have been unsure of. It has been very helpful to me during my journey.

author: willowtree6689
title: Children’s Occupational Therapy Appt.
body:
My daughter was referred to OT through her nursery as she is prone to a lot of “rocking” as well as a need for a lot of sensory feedback from objects/people. The whole process from being referred has been super quick which is really pleasing. I have another child who is on the CAHMS waiting list (and has been for a year and a half!) so I know how important these early interventions and discoveries could be.  
My first appointment with Sarah was a parent only appt - which I was a little nervous about but she made me feel very at ease. She understood when I explained behaviours and gave me great feedback there and then - as well as explaining what the next steps would be. I’m so pleased that my daughter/us as parents/nursery is getting help so quickly as it only benefits the child rather than having to wait for long periods of time.

author: Patient1957
title: Can't get appointment with GP, even though they told me to make one
body: My GP told me to make an appointment to see them, but the surgery won't give me one. This can be frustrating, but also makes me agitated, which then affects my mental health I suffer from bipolar disorder.

author: Morgans71
title: Couldn't have asked for better support
body: I was took as soon as I arrived and felt very comfortable with nurse Julie. I was then seen by Dr Bhat who took all my information before examinations. I was then took to examinations room by nurse Fran and Julie and was made feel very comfortable and at ease. I was updated and reassured all through the examination by doctor and nurses which made it more bearable. Couldn't have asked for better support from doctor and nurses.

author: piscesbp69
title: Prompt attention for my medical needs
body:
Dr Drew provided quick attention to my need for new medication. Very prompt reply to my email this morning (one hour later) and forwarded my prescriptions to the Chemist. Also Dr Drew completed a chest x-ray request for the Homerton Hospital at the same time.  
Just great and prompt attention for my medical needs - Thank you Dr Drew.

author: HCxx
title: The care I received was faultless
body:
I had surgery in January of this year on my knee and went to the day surgery unit within the New Victoria hospital.  
The care I received was faultless. The staff at all stages were excellent at explaining what was going to happen and when. I felt very relaxed in their care.  
A special thanks to Kerry who recovered me. She made me feel at ease, and she was kind and professional at all times.  
The whole experience of my day surgery was very organised and I felt included at every stage.

author: Complex Patient
title: Infection Control
body:
Staff were not disinfecting Obs equipment between patient contact, which is something I've raised several times in the past.  
I contracted Covid for a 3rd time whilst in Hospital, despite being fully vaccinated. All 3 of my Covid infections occurred as a Hospital inpatient. I was very surprised that it was OK for Covid positive patients to be in the same area as other acutely unwell, elderly & vulnerable patients, with equipment being shared. When I queried this, having been Shielding for 3 years due to being clinically extremely vulnerable to Covid, I was told it was OK because there's a gap between the beds. There were no disinfectant wipes on board the Obs trolley, and staff had to be asked to clean the equipment, each & every time they came to the bedside to check my Obs. This is a very basic infection control requirement & not taking the necessary steps to prevent the spread of infection in a Hospital setting is inexcusable.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: earthtd97
title: There’s nothing to fault them with at all
body:
The Covid clinic was all good really. I had no problem whatsoever with it. I was supposed to have gone for a cancer review. I did a Covid test with one of the new tests at the hospital and that turned out to be positive after I had taken a negative lateral flow.  
After this, I was invited to the Covid clinic for maybe some other tests and potential treatment. And I guess all of this experience was good. I didn't try the treatments because I showed no real symptoms. I was on no other medication for Cancer treatment and they didn't think there'd be much point going ahead with the Covid treatment. The staff were good and supportive. Communication was good and the called me back promptly to let me know that I wouldn't be taking treatment for Covid.  
The lady who called me was very helpful and sent me a text number to message them if the symptoms got more serious or worse. We also spoke after the weekend and another lateral flow showed I was negative.  
My wife can’t have any vaccines or boosters; and was recommended not to touch the vaccines by Dr as she had previously had a reaction to a flu vaccines. And I wondered if it would be helpful for people who can’t have vaccines to have access to this service. My and my wife have previously had Covid. My wife ended up in hospital about 5-7 days after initial confirmation and spent nearly a week in the hospital and so I think would be a good candidate for this service in this circumstance. We have spoken to other professionals but no one seems to have any answers, so I think it is worth mentioning here-I think it needs to be highlighted and people who can't have vaccines need to not be forgotten about.  
But the Trust in my case have been absolutely brilliant, including dealing with my prostrate cancer (the operation for this was performed at Exeter hospital and was excellent).My tumour in the colon was dealt with at Devon and they looked after me excellently. Barnstaple have looked after me since and I can’t thank them and praise them enough. The surgeon, the team and the staff in general-there’s nothing to fault them at all.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: tangogy64
title: Too many cooks when trying to contact physio
body:
I had a physio appointment but the road was closed and there was no buses. Got back home and phone number on letter and receptionist apparently put me through but I kept being cut off. Apparently I was being put through to Barnstaple not Bideford where the physio was - a different place - and also the physio clinic don’t answer phone when doing sessions.  
I was called next morning and I explained what happened to a young man, and a woman called after that and I went through it all again. I told the woman I had an appointment booked for mid April and she said I can’t have as there are no clinics on that day. But then I got a letter a few days later telling me there WAS a session on that day and I went to it.  
It feels like a case of too many cooks, and I am not happy. I feel like if I wasn’t able to get the bus again I would have to go through this experience all over again. You should be able to call up when you can’t get to your appointment and speak to someone and book another session. It created a lot of stress after being stressed waiting at the bus stop  
I don’t want to give my details I just want to pass on that this happened.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: slidecg87
title: I am really grateful!
body:
I had an appointment at the leg yesterday. The appointment was two hours long. A young lady really did take care of me and followed up the next day with a call. The communication was brilliant. I have another appointment next week and until my leg is ok.  
I am really grateful!

author: pagerwb65
title: Wait times
body: Waited 3 hours for 10 minute eye appointment. Staff are knowledgable and helpful but clearly not enough of them

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Deb642
title: Seamless service
body:
Visiting Ireland for a family funeral. Mum unfortunately took a tumble on some steps and sustained a large gash to her leg.  
Seamless service. Checked in and treated with fantastic care. Thanks to the Nurse/Nurse practitioner that cared for her. Just wonderful  
Thanks 😊

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anxious Amy
title: Spoken to in a demeaning manner
body:
I had lost my hearing aid, which I am dependent upon in the workplace  
I attended the QEUH audiology department and explained my situation. I was informed there was a 10-week waiting list for lost hearing aids.  
I explained that I had an agreement with my ENT consultant that I could attend audiology on a drop-in basis for assistance  
This reasonable adjustment has enabled me to fulfill my role at work.  
I was spoken to in a demeaning manner, told that I won’t get seen any quicker. I felt totally humiliated, as there were other patients in the vicinity and that because I had lost my hearing aid I would have to suffer the consequences. I informed the person I spoke to that I would contact my consultant via their secretary to resolve the matter.  
I found the person I spoke with in ENT to be extremely professional and had gone above and beyond to be of assistance, but to no avail.  
I have also spoken to the lead audiologist. I was informed there was nothing documented in my notes. Implying my account of events was untrue.  
Unfortunately my consultant has now retired.  
I also did not appreciate the sarcastic comments I was subjected to during the call.  
I have had no issues in the last 20 yrs with this agreement until now, hence my utter disbelief and disappointment I found staff to be unprofessional and obstructive, more determined to prove a point than provide any meaningful support.  
I consider this indirect discrimination in terms of being at a substantial disadvantage that I cannot access equipment to meet my needs. Furthermore to wait 10 weeks for a replacement is absolutely appalling service provision for patients

author: Amy182
title: Amazing scan experience
body: Today I had my 12-week scan, the lovely Michelle who done my scan made me feel so at ease, especially as I was so nervous. Honestly, staff members like Michelle are an absolute credit to the NHS. So thank you for making our first scan so memorable, calm and informative. Keep up the amazing work

author: Leonardo 121
title: Phsiotherapy and occupational therapy
body:
I am undergoing treatment for cancer, initially high grade lymphoma that responded well to chemotherapy, however, I have follicular lymphoma that is not curable.  
I have had numerous hospital admissions resulting in pneumonia and sepsis and had treatment. This has greatly impacted on me physically and mentally and I struggle with daily activities like walking and having pain. I was fortunate enough to be referred for assessment and firstly met Carrie (physiotherapist) and Fiona (Occupational therapist).  
Carrie is a credit to her profession. She was extremely kind and caring, applied a comprehensive assessment in ensuring adaptations were requested and assisted me with posture and mobility. Carrie must be commended for this level of support to patients.  
Fiona also had attributes like Carrie. She assessed myself, environment and made recommendations for adaptions to assist with my daily living. She helped me understand the impact that my prognosis had on my life.  
I fully appreciate that there are constraints that can impact on care. Funding is an issue and I hope to highlight this should anyone who reads this is aware that these are highly skilled health professionals who are restricted by political decisions that can impact òn what they want to deliver but may not have the funding to do so. That was never mentioned by these excellent professionals.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Seahawk824
title: Friendly and efficient staff
body:
Was admitted to Wellington after emergency ward, having suffered an asthma attack. All staff were friendly and efficient  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Environment']

author: Author123456789
title: Caring and compassionate MRI Staff
body:
I went for an MRI today at Glasgow Royal Infirmary. I was very nervous about it due to a previous bad experience of a precious MRI (no-one's fault). I was so nervous I for myself into a bit of a state. All of the staff were extremely calm, kind & caring, in particular, Mary & David.  
They really looked after me, were understanding, took my concerns seriously and did everything they could to make it a much less traumatic experience than I'd imagined.  
I am very grateful for the level of care & compassion.

author: Jimjp64
title: After first cataract lens replacement
body:
Just a suggestion  
Cataract unit /Opticians  
I had a very successful cataract lens replacement four weeks ago. I went as advised to my opticians, who said the result was excellent. I gave the optician the envelope the cataract unit had given me, and I asked about the second cataract removal.  
The optician said if they were going to do it, then they would have put a red sticker on the envelope, so it was not to be done.  
Now when I was referred two years ago it was stated both eyes.  
When after eighteen months I was examined by the cataract unit, they said yes, now which eye will we do first.  
It was decided my right eye as that had been my dominant eye.  
(I took it as when they said first they implied that the second one would be done later.)  
Now when I was initially referred, both cataracts were as bad as each other  
Now the outstanding one after two years is worse than originally stated.  
It seems to me that the ball was in my court, to ask for a further referral, ie:- a further two-year wait, or the optician should have made the referral after operation results.  
I have no real complaints, just a suggestion that the patient is taken out of decision making, of if you get automatic with the RED sticker or have to discuss with your optician, if you want the second eye done.  
(Of course we want it done.)  
I know lots of people have cataract operations, but in my case I am 76 years old, my daughter even put stickers on the envelope saying give this one to the optician and I almost have left and right written on my slippers :-)  
I did not realise that if I did not instigate it my second op would not be done.

author: lynxhk84
title: Telephone consultation
body: I received a call from Vicky, diabetic nurse at Ladybank. She explained in easy to understand detail about my diabetes and what I could do to improve my readings. She was professional, clear in her advice and a pleasure to speak to.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Simo78
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My Recovery Worker
body: It will be a shame to see Sam go as he started me on my recovery journey. I wish him all the very best in his new role.

author: bravo62
title: Excellent care by the breast team.
body:
I would like to thank all staff at The New Stobhill Hospital Breast Clinic today for their excellent care and consideration.  
The staff at Ms MacLeans clinic were caring, kind and efficient. Kelly the Specialist Breast Nurse helped me to feel relaxed and listened to. The process of being examined, attending the Mammogram unit and then receiving my results could have been very daunting but I left feeling very reassured.  
The process was very efficient however I felt cared for by everyone including Yvonne in the Mammogram Unit who made me feel comfortable and relaxed during the procedure. Thank you also to the clinic nurses who expertly managed the clinic and to the efficient reception staff. Everyone worked together to make what could have been a difficult experience much easier

author: Sorebackdaughter
title: Caring, supportive and professional
body:
We attended an Orthopaedic out patient appointment to see Dr Shaharyar. After the examination, he made the decision to admit my daughter, who was suffering from a back injury, struggling to walk and in a lot of pain.  
Ward 3C was great and all staff work so hard, are very caring, supportive and professional. However, we asked for stronger painkillers during the night and the poor night shift nurses were rushed off their feet and so busy that my daughter was distressed and unsettled for a while until she was given the appropriate drugs.  
One member of the team that stood out for us was Nurse Sarah. She took us to the MRI, was so positive, professional, reassuring and cheery, just what was needed to distract my worried daughter. Sarah also looked after us on the ward and is a credit to her profession.  
Dr Shaharyar kept us informed of what he had planned, remained calm, was informative and was determined to help my daughter. We are so grateful for his help and care. Thank you.

author: Ellie58
title: The wonderful care and treatment received
body:
I was a day patient in Ward 202, Urology. I received such excellent care that I felt wanted to provide this feedback. From the moment I entered the unit until I was discharged, I received the highest standard of care from all the staff. I was made to feel at ease and confident that I was receiving the best care possible. Very proud of our NHS.  
Well done, Ward 202

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: EK Grateful Wife
title: All of the staff are a credit to the hospital
body:
We are from Glasgow area and whilst on a 2-day break my husband became unwell. We went reluctantly to Fraserburgh Hospital, where he was diagnosed with a heart attack .  
The paramedics were fantastic that transferred him to Aberdeen, particularly Colene, who kept me informed as I couldn’t travel in the ambulance  
In Aberdeen Royal Infirmary he was placed in CCU Ward 106a. The care he received was first class. Well Informed of every procedure and the staff so attentive .  
What was a terrifying experience, particularly away from home, was eased by the care and attention my husband received .  
I would like to thank Iona and the amazing trainer nurse Rachael .  
But all of the staff are a credit to the hospital .  
Thanks again, and my husband is on the mend thanks to you all .

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: bmc875
title: The curate's egg
body:
Just spent 8 days in Cardio at Crosshouse, Kilmarnock.  
From Domestics, porters, background staff etc, through Junior Doctors - can't be faulted. Magnificent.  
Consultants? Appear to have forgotten how to Doctor. The main aim seemed to be to discharge me. Long time since I have been patronised so intensely.

author: herontd79
title: All went very smoothly
body: All went very smoothly and did not take very long

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Juni
title: Birth and delivery
body:
My worst experience at the Hillingdon hospital, it will live with me forever. I got induced and the pain kicked in so quickly. I was rushed into the labour ward and given an epidural. In less than a few minutes one of the staff snatched it of me, as if I was not deserving , no explanation or anything just like that.  
I was in so much pain that I could not hold it in. One of the staff turned back to me and said look at me , listen to me stop screaming and push, no empathy whatsoever. I will never forget how angry they looked when they said that. They told me to push - I pushed. When I pushed they said not like that! No-one had explained to me how I was suppose to push, then one of them said push as if you are doing a poo, however they seemed concerned about when last I had opened my bowels.  
I was in pain. The thing I wanted was to get the baby out, not being asked when last I opened my bowels. When I pushed the way they had told me which was only one push chance they gave me, they told me they were going to help me. They put some stuff to support my legs. After that I remember the doctor twisting my inside. It was so painful , more than the labour pain , I asked what they were doing? All of a sudden I heard them shouting, holding a small syringe, and saying they were removing urine from my bladder.  
It has been over six months now that pain is still there. Just as I thought I had seen enough, the baby was born. When the midwife was handing over my baby, they called her monkey? They all laughed. I had already lost my self esteem from the way they had handled me when I was giving birth.  
When it was time to go to the ward , the midwife, asked if they could dress my baby while I change. I agreed and then I hear them saying monkey, hello monkey, repeating themselves. This time I got angry and I confronted them. They asked what her name was and I told them. They looked at me as if my baby was not deserving of that name.  
When it was time to go to the ward , they asked if I could walk to the ward. I said no - I was anaemic and had just given birth. They brought a chair and pushed me to the ward , no communication whatsoever. It was the worst experience of my life , I will never forget it. No respect or empathy.  
They was only one member of staff at the end who came and apologised for the epidural being taken off me. When I was transferred to a post birth ward, the midwife who attended to me , asked if I was ok, because another midwife had told her about the treatment I had received in the labour ward. I could not answer much as I was so angry. When I rang and complained to the trust, they told me the midwife had left the trust and they were going to speak to the rest of the team .  
My beautiful, angelic , one in a million baby fills our hearts with so much joy, I’m glad God gave her to us.

title: Great experience
body: Just wanted to say how good my experience was today at The Jubilee Day Surgery department. From start to finish I've been blown away by every single member of staff today. Thank you so much for making my ear operation as good an experience as possible. Every one of you , thank you

title: Great experience
body: I have had cataract surgery on both my eyes in January and March of this year. All the staff I met in pre op and during both procedures, were fantastic.

title: Great practice
body:
Very helpful, I would recommend this gp to all my friends and my family as well.
I really had a good experience with her. Thank you

author: Easter23
title: Care received was second to none
body: Spent a week in the care of the staff and nurses on ward S11. During this time they were able to get to the bottom of various health concerns and the help and care received was second to none. Everyone from the cleaning staff to the Ward Doctors were excellent and helped to make all patients feel important. I cannot thank the staff enough and words don’t really seem adequate, but what a fantastic team.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful experience after so long
body: I felt the need to leave a review here as for the first time in a very long while, I’ve felt my voice was heard by a health professional and something was done. I had previously spoken with a couple of temporary/locum gps and couldn’t get them to even listen to me and was told on one occasion to be quick as only 5minutes were left !! This time, I luckily got an appointment with a new GP who I think will be a regular gp at reach health and not a locum). She listened to me, She was so kind and explained everything in very nice way and I felt that I didn’t have to struggle. I felt so relieved after talking to her. We need more doctors like her!

author: composerde57
title: Breastfeeding advice
body:
I was in a lot of pain breastfeeding with blisters, bleeding and blocked ducts all because my baby’s latch was all wrong. I know the benefits are so good for breastfed baby and gut health, so I continued feeding with the pain using Sheilds.  
I got an appointment with Nicola the breastfeeding consultant and she was excellent straight away and had me feeding my baby pain free.  
It makes breastfeeding a joy again.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ayla2014
title: Friendly and helpful
body: Good service, friendly and helpful

title: Fantastic practice
body: I’d moved from one borough to Warrington over 12 months ago hence I changed Gp practices. I’ve been amazed by them. The doctors are extremely compassionate and knowledgeable and listen to my concerns and treat me accordingly. The receptionists are very friendly and welcoming. Getting an appointment has not been an issue for me or my son. The service also offers a satellite surgery sometimes for on the day appointments if none available on site. I’ve never had a problem with prescriptions, as they are sent from the surgery to my chosen pharmacy electronically. Keep doing what you’re doing :) thank you

title: No complaints
body: The waiting area was clean, reception staff welcoming.  Booking in machine was easy to use and I was called for my appointment on time.  I have no complaints about the service I received.

title: Very Helpful Receptionist
body: I contacted the Wem Surgery to obtain details from my medical records. The Receptionist was extremely helpful, understood immediately the information I required, quickly located it, aprovided me with the necessary details and gave advice accordingly. Thank you for being both  polite and courteous.

title: Hysteroscopy procedure
body:
I just wanted to commend the consultant and nurses who carried out this procedure today.
It had been fast referral and I had been extremely anxious about attending.
I was immediately welcomed by a warm, welcoming and reassuring team and this continued throughout and post procedure. I felt very comfortable with all staff involved and this enabled me to overcome any anxieties. I would not hesitate to recommend this department. Outstanding care from start to finish. Thank you all.

title: Great practice, v friendly staff
body: Dealt by friendly staff who explained thoroughly the procedure. Very clean practice and ample waiting area with a TV. Lift also available if needed.

author: rosiex4
title: This hospital defies the odds and is a credit to the NHS
body:
My son had eye surgery. Throughout the journey of his operation, the care given by all staff was 5*. And this counts towards every single staff member. Jess and Gill on Caroline Thorpe ward are absolutely amazing, their duty of care towards children and parents/guardians was to the best standard. The play specialist (I didn’t catch a name), was so helpful and engaging. Then there was the sleepy doctors team (as they called themselves) who put my son to sleep at such ease, it wasn’t traumatic for him and me at all! I felt at such ease and knew my son was being looked after so well. His surgeon, Mr. Gibbon, made every effort to meet my son’s needs and was so calming and reassuring. He has done a fantastic job and I am truly thankful.  
The team in recovery department were fantastic and calming when my son came around. My son found it quite frightening at first and they were so lovely towards us, and wasn’t phased at all. I didn’t catch a name, but the lady in particular was a wonderful woman who made sure he was comfortable. The porter who came to get my son from the recovery room to Caroline Thorpe ward, was so chatty and nice. A really lovely chap.  
After a very long day, my son got given tea and as there was food leftover, the caterer (who gives food out on the wards) gave me some tea as well (I was very hungry as I didn’t want to upset my son by eating in front of him!) This was such a nice thing to do and I felt so looked after by all of the team. The food was lovely!!  
The hospital is an absolute credit to the NHS. Through these uncertain times, this hospital defies all odds and I am truly grateful.  
Just a huge thank you for looking after my son yesterday… I couldn’t have asked for better even if I was a private paying patient.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional staff across the board
body: At the moment I am still in hospital following an unexpected overnight stay. I must admit, I was very concerned after a long wait yesterday, some difficulty during the op. Throughout the past 24 hours plus, the staff were excellent working around me, they were calm reassuring and very professional. Yes I am still here, seen a couple of shift changes and am very grateful for the manner in which I have been treated.

author: redtj95
title: Amazing Maternity services
body: We welcomes our perfect baby boy into the world with the help of the fantastic maternity team in Altnagelvin. From antenatal, through labor ward and postnatal everybody was so supportive. We felt listened to and our preferences and choices were supported throughout. Thank you so much you are all amazing.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very good practice
body:
Always good service and always friendly 
Usually it’s possible to get a appointment within a short period of time

author: Amanda382
title: A very positive experience
body:
I attended the Newlyn Unit, and had a very positive experience.  
All of the staff were fantastic and treated me very well. I had explained to the anesthesiologist that I was very anxious about waking up in pain due to my existing spinal condition. He listened and made sure I had excellent pain control in recovery and all the the recovery staff were brilliant. They were all very kind , caring and professional.  
Thank you very much to you all, and to Dr Borley for arranging everything.

title: Friendly service
body: I called today to book a routine appointment - the queues were long but I ave to say that the callback service is a brilliant addition! The male receptionist I spoke to was very helpful and friendly and a surprise as I expect just female receptionists. The only criticisms I would give is the whole month wait for a routine appointment (although I'm aware the Triage system can get someone same-day appointments if needed) and that anyone in all five of their surgeries can answer a call so you could be calling for Tring and be answered by their Berkhamsted branch (which happened to me) which might not be good for the staff if they only know one site and not the others. Still, I've been with the Tring practice my whole life and even after they started expanding, they've always been focussed on getting the right help for their patients.

author: zuludg79
title: I would like to thank them for helping me get my life back
body:
Although previously anxious, on arriving at detox I was made to feel very welcome and put at ease.  
I have met some nice people who I have given numbers to so we can stay in touch and support each other.  
The facilities are brilliant and all the staff are fantastic and quite often under appreciated, and I would like to thank them for helping me get my life back.

title: Excellent gp practise with superb care
body:
I want to say a massive thanks to drs and nurses I have seen in the last week at Upavon and durrington practises 
Their care was prompt efficient and kind 
Seldom I am unwell used to work as a neuro sister and I can only say their expertise was brilliant 
I also want to thank them for setting up walk in clinics to get prompt attention 
Many thanks here’s to a full recovery

title: Fantastic experience
body: I had my baby at St James' Hospital over New Year. The staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble. A very positive experience from start to finish. The midwife stayed with me from start to finish and even a little after her shift had finished. The theatre staff were amazing and the after care care was superior.

title: Great members of staff
body: After a lengthy wait on the phone, I got an appointment within two hours. I was seen on time, the practitioner I saw was great, nothing was too much trouble. He was very thorough in checking and diagnosing my problem. His manner was very reassuring and he took his time with me. Having diagnosed my problem he requested a prescription from a doctor, which I picked up from the pharmacy during the visit. Having been ill for three weeks and being reluctant seek help, due to the current pressure the NHS is under. I decided I could wait no longer. I’m glad I did and was most impressed by the prompt action of the patient coordinator in booking me an appointment. My final comment is a big thankyou to the practitioner for his excellent service.

author: bluers85
title: Help and support
body:
I was having issues around eating especially in front of people and was going for long periods of time without any food due to this. I went to the GP with my Mum and he referred me to the CAMHS Eating Disorder Team in Armagh.  
From my first appointment I felt so at ease. Nicola made me feel comfortable and I was able to talk openly to her. I attended 3 or 4 more times and every time I felt much better. I am now doing well and am able to socialise with my friends and family. I would like to thank the team for all their help and support.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lohope
title: The staff really worked well as a team
body:
I attended the Gynaecology outpatient clinic for a routine procedure. However, I had to return quickly due to an unforeseen reaction. I was seen immediately and subsequently admitted to the gynaecology ward.  
The care I received was excellent. Every single staff member I met was attentive, compassionate and despite me keeping them busy, they were there picking up the pieces at every turn, making sure I was comfortable and easing my anxieties.  
I could see how busy they were in the clinic and ward, but I was always met with a smile, good humour and never a complaint. The staff really worked well as a team, supporting each other to make sure everyone was cared for.  
Thank you very much to you all!

title: Fantastic service
body: From when I entered to when I left the experience was amazing.  I was very nervous and the staff did everything they could to put me at ease.  Thank you so much

title: Always there
body: Hawthorns has been our family surgery for years and have always been there when needed. Their appointment system works well, even during the busiest of times and that is reassuring knowing we can see someone when needed.

author: jivenc65
title: I cannot say enough in praise of this service.
body:
My wife has attended the Stevenson daycare centre in Largs for the last six weeks.  
From not wanting to go she has come to looking forward to going.  
All the girls there have been fantastic with her and have made her feel at ease and comfortable with the daycare surroundings and activities.  
I cannot say enough in praise of this service.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Ward 3 is nothing short of amazing
body:
I was sent here from royal Derby, from the first minute until the very last ward 3 was amazing, the staff from hostesses to sisters , hca staff , physio team, occupational therapy team, nurses and maintenance and cleaning, they were absolutely fantastic, really couldn't fault 1 aspect of my stay here which was 4 weeks. I've got so much admiration for this ward . They really helped me and everyone else in there. 
This ward is a massive credit to the nhs

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding service and care
body: Arrived at A&E around 3pm. As expected, it was busy, therefore I was prepared to wait to be seen. The service I received was exemplary. Under what I perceived to be very demanding conditions, the staff were excellent; I was reassured by the thorough examinations I received. The staff were admirable.

title: No point in staying in this Practice anymore
body: Took 88 minutes to answer my phone. No appointments available for the whole week, asked to turn up and they will squeeze me in. When I turned up reception staff told me there was only one locum doctor in who was out on a visit. Reception staff very rude, and loud, and laughing and joking without doing any work. Completely empty place with maybe one nurse alone. No regular GP's all locums now. No point in staying in this practice its very very unsafe.

title: Very pleasant ladies
body: I had a very short visit to investigate what turned out to be a harmless lesion on my foot.  The doctor and trainee couldn't have been more sympathetic and charming.  The only downside was the maze like hospital site which is difficult to navigate because of the extensive building works! Luckily I arrived at my appointment with 5 minutes to spare.

title: Great and pleasant service
body: When calling to query a second appointment made, the call representative was incredibly helpful, informative and accommodating.  I have also noticed a huge improvement in appointment availability since the opening of the new surgery.

title: Really good experience
body: Received great support from nhs 111 advising me to go to hospital, when I arrived my referral was already at accident and emergency , my subsequent examination and treatment was thorough and although I had to return to the surgical assessment unit the following morning the experience was really supportive and thorough. Throughout the experience all levels of staff were kind and professional, maintaining my dignity in what was a very undignified situation. I am incredibly grateful that the hospital and its staff were there for me.

title: Great doctors
body:
I recently joined the practice along with my two children having just moved to the area and I am very pleased to have done so. 

I have needed two appointments for my child who has been unwell over several weeks and did not have trouble seeing a doctor& getting an appointment. 

On both occasions, in the appointment I felt listened to and appreciated how thorough the questions were by each doctor and that they clearly explained their assessment and the reasons for their recommendations.

I also found them to be empathetic and gave me choices as the parent and the option to return if symptoms did not improve which is always reassuring particularly with a baby. 

Great doctors!

author: Hamilton2023
title: A credit to the Ambulance Service
body:
I took unwell at work and my colleagues phoned the emergency service, who allocated an ambulance crew.  
They were amazing !!!  
They arrived within 10 minutes of the call .  
The crew consisted of Rebekah,Geraldine and Laura (Paramedic student) from Hamilton station.  
They were a credit to the Ambulance Service demonstrating care and compassion .They reassured me and my colleagues and eased the anxiety that we all had.  
They all had an exceptional manner and provided a first class service.  
I am extremely grateful to all 3 of them and wish to thank them for looking after me so well.

title: Terrible
body:
On a number of occasions i have been disapointed with the service. 
Im 29 years old and went up about a lump as i was worried it could be serious and i was told im to young for it to be cancer i was also told that the pain i was experiencing was due to my mental health not my physical which was not correct. Another occasion (today) i took my 7 year old son to see the doctor and after 5mins half way through me explaining my concerns the doctor shook her head and said you cant talk about more than one issue. Most the receptionist are also rude and not helpful at all. Doctors like this should be ashamed, their job is to help people and help save lifes but its far from what they are doing!

title: Telephone call
body: Thankyou for getting back to me this morning after me leaving a message here yesterday. My new appointment has now been booked.

title: Poor practice
body: I'm looking at changing gp surgery due to the service I've received. I've experienced poor communication and poor organisation. It's extremely hard to get hold of anyone at the practice and I've found staff to be un-caring and unhelpful.

title: First Class Service
body: From the moment I arrived I was treated with courtesy,respect and professionalism right throughout my treatment and cannot praise the Service enough, thank you, On leaving I was well looked after until I got into my Cab to go home so again Thank you

title: Well done.
body: I was admitted yesterday for a pacemaker box change. As this is done under local anaesthetic l was understandably nervous. I found all the staff, from reception up to and including the consultant who performed the actual surgery, extremely sympathetic and reassuring. I benefitted from the latest in plasma incisions and welcome sedation and was extremely pleased to be discharged home by 5 pm. A big thankyou to all the team. PS worth every penny of their raise.

title: Great Care - Responsive
body: I have been with the Hounslow Family since I was born. Theres a clear reason for this, it is because the surgery has always gone the extra mile to support me. They are responsive and caring. Introducing the new ask my GP function is amazing, they always get back to me so fast. I had Vertigo and High Blood Pressure and I was contacted promptly with steps on what i should do next. This is a GP surgery that really does care.

title: Fantastic
body: Very smooth and well organised spring booster clinic. Being a wheelchair user they were very helpful and assisted me through the surgery with ease. Nurses explained everything clearly and were sensitive to my needs- thank you

title: generally poor practice
body:
I've been with this surgery over 30 years and have never known it to be as bad as it is now for getting to see a doctor.
8 a.m. only calls for an appointment. That is ridiculous in my opinion.
The nurses themselves are very good and helpful.
Reception. Well, I think they only state what they are told by management regard appointments, otherwise they try to be helpful.
I think this surgery needs an overhaul at the top.

title: Great practice
body:
Fast response fir Doctor appointment for a 3year old boy 
Doctor checked child thoroughly and prescribed the relevant medication. 
Very pleased with the visit.

title: Dreadful
body:
The hospital is extremely dirty.
Gowns on the floor.
Expected to take a urine test in dirty toilets.
Medical and reception on personal phone.
I witnessed elderly being completely neglected.
Heartbreaking.

title: First Class Service
body: From the moment I arrived I was treated with courtesy,respect and professionalism right throughout my treatment and cannot praise the Service enough, thank you, On leaving I was well looked after until I got into my Cab to go home so again Thank you

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I have always found this practice to be excellent. They prompt you for regular health checks. I literally couldn’t be happier with professional services they provide.

title: Quick phone call
body: I phoned for an appointment and was speaking to a receptionist within a minute. Very quick and I was given an appropriate appointment.

author: Ozzie225
title: Social worker
body:
When I came off my holiday the social worker was texting me to ask to arrange a meeting with them. I was confused because I already had a meeting arranged, so my dad texted them back asking if it was still on and they said no because I asked them to speak to someone.  
I phoned my social worker angry, asking if all appointments were cancelled then I went quiet. They decided to hang up the phone and texted saying that they had no opportunity to answer me. When they did the next appointment, they didn’t turn up at my house. They texted my dad to say that they were not going as I blocked their number.  
I ended up self harming and feeling suicidal all because of my social worker. I phoned to ask to talk to the duty worker. No response for almost 2 weeks as the admin staff put it through to my social worker who in turned didn’t phone on the day they were meant to turn up. I got the blame of phoning 100 times where there’s no evidence that it was me and they told my dad about it.  
Social worker has failed to get the support sorted out in a timely manner, as I didn’t like the person who was supporting me. Now the social worker only emailed the manager of the company and nothing was getting done about it. Earlier last month, still nothing. Still accepting that they are still finding someone so I texted the manager saying that they didn’t care if I got support or not and my social worker got me into trouble, saying this is not how to deal with it.  
After the holiday, my social worker turned around and said that the company can’t find anyone else to support me now. I’m struggling without it and it feels like the social worker doesn’t care if I self harm or feel suicidal. It has gotten to the point where if they mess me around one more time I’m going to overdose as they seem to get away with not doing anything. I have tried to talk to the social worker manager. They have not returned the phone call when they spoke to my dad which isn’t on either.  
All my relationships with the CMHT has ended in the same way, where I overdose because they mess me around not turn up for appointments make excuses etc. I've been with them for years and now I was wrongly diagnosed with borderline personality disorder and I now have autism. I find this unreal.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

title: Good experience
body:
I needed an appointment so I rang around 8am, after 25 min I talked to the lovely receptionist and managed one on the same day. Everything went smoothly and the Dr. and nurse that saw me and took my bloods were caring and professional. Did bloods the same day after the consultation as thought urgent. This is the second time that Gordon Street managed to help me in a rush. Last time I even passed out due to being weak from a pharynge infection and everyone was so helpful and nice. I'm alone in this country and it gets scary to be ill but so far I´ve been lucky with my experiences.

I know sometimes things don't work their best but I think It's only fair to compliment when they do. Thank you everyone.

title: No respect towards patients
body: Had an ENT appointment at 6:20pm on 19 Apr 2023. The automatic reminder message contained the text "You may incur a charge if you do not advise us that you cannot attend" which is extremely unfriendly and disrespectful in light of what happened next. I arrived on time, filled in the patient form with the reception downstairs and was sent upstairs to 2nd floor. There I was told the clinician who was due to see me is not on site. I didn't receive a call or text message to notify me so I don't make the unnecessary trip. The staff upstairs helped me reschedule the appointment to 6:20pm on the Monday 24th but was unapologetic. The staff downstairs was much nicer but it seems they can't help. Very unprofessional and disrespectful way of treating patients. I should also be compensated for the time and cost of my travel to the hospital.

title: Highly Efficient
body:
Everyone I was in contact with were very pleasant, professional and knowledgeable which had a calming effect to the patient.
Good, pleasant surroundings with good parking facilities.

title: Woefully inadequate service
body:
The main issue most people have is just that fact that it's hard to get an appointment.

But God forbid you're running late you miss your appt even though they're running 4 appts behind? The staff aren't the problem it's the booking system and time keeping, don't have 10 minute appts if you know they will each take 15 minutes.

I've been left without medication and no one at the center appears to be bothered to help.

title: unsafe
body: i don’t know how this nm health innovations group is able to open more services or keep the ones they have open. impossible to get an appointment. receptionist are rude and have no respect for confidentiality. why are you unable to book an appointment without telling the receptionist why? If I need a longer appointment I will ask. everyone should have access to health care & it’s unsafe to wait for 4 weeks plus. shouldn’t have to beg for a appointment

title: Exceptional care
body: I  cannot thank the two doctors enough that I saw last week and yesterday.The kindness, compassion and understanding that they have expressed to me was much appreciated.Also not forgetting the kindness and friendliness of the gentleman that took my blood test.Thank you.
